register.description: Peripheral release details.

bitfield.description: RTL revision number - actual value determined by RTL
Major revision number - actual value determined by RTL
Custom revision number - actual value determined by RTL
Minor revision number - actual value determined by RTL

register.description: Indicates the configuration of this set of PLL control registers.

bitfield.description: Indicates PLL15 presence and type 0h - PLL is not present 1h - Standard ADPLLM is present 2h - Low-jitter ADPLLLJM is present 3h - Reserved
Indicates PLL14 presence and type 0h - PLL is not present 1h - Standard ADPLLM is present 2h - Low-jitter ADPLLLJM is present 3h - Reserved
Indicates PLL13 presence and type 0h - PLL is not present 1h - Standard ADPLLM is present 2h - Low-jitter ADPLLLJM is present 3h - Reserved
Indicates PLL12 presence and type 0h - PLL is not present 1h - Standard ADPLLM is present 2h - Low-jitter ADPLLLJM is present 3h - Reserved
Indicates PLL11 presence and type 0h - PLL is not present 1h - Standard ADPLLM is present 2h - Low-jitter ADPLLLJM is present 3h - Reserved
Indicates PLL10 presence and type 0h - PLL is not present 1h - Standard ADPLLM is present 2h - Low-jitter ADPLLLJM is present 3h - Reserved
Indicates PLL9 presence and type 0h - PLL is not present 1h - Standard ADPLLM is present 2h - Low-jitter ADPLLLJM is present 3h - Reserved
Indicates PLL8 presence and type 0h - PLL is not present 1h - Standard ADPLLM is present 2h - Low-jitter ADPLLLJM is present 3h - Reserved
Indicates PLL7 presence and type 0h - PLL is not present 1h - Standard ADPLLM is present 2h - Low-jitter ADPLLLJM is present 3h - Reserved
Indicates PLL6 presence and type 0h - PLL is not present 1h - Standard ADPLLM is present 2h - Low-jitter ADPLLLJM is present 3h - Reserved
Indicates PLL5 presence and type 0h - PLL is not present 1h - Standard ADPLLM is present 2h - Low-jitter ADPLLLJM is present 3h - Reserved
Indicates PLL4 presence and type 0h - PLL is not present 1h - Standard ADPLLM is present 2h - Low-jitter ADPLLLJM is present 3h - Reserved
Indicates PLL3 presence and type 0h - PLL is not present 1h - Standard ADPLLM is present 2h - Low-jitter ADPLLLJM is present 3h - Reserved
Indicates PLL2 presence and type 0h - PLL is not present 1h - Standard ADPLLM is present 2h - Low-jitter ADPLLLJM is present 3h - Reserved
Indicates PLL1 presence and type 0h - PLL is not present 1h - Standard ADPLLM is present 2h - Low-jitter ADPLLLJM is present 3h - Reserved
Indicates PLL0 presence and type 0h - PLL is not present 1h - Standard ADPLLM is present 2h - Low-jitter ADPLLLJM is present 3h - Reserved

register.description: Indicates the configuration of this set of PLL control registers.

bitfield.description: Indicates the number of High Speed dividers used on PLL15
Indicates the number of High Speed dividers used on PLL14
Indicates the number of High Speed dividers used on PLL13
Indicates the number of High Speed dividers used on PLL12
Indicates the number of High Speed dividers used on PLL11
Indicates the number of High Speed dividers used on PLL10
Indicates the number of High Speed dividers used on PLL9
Indicates the number of High Speed dividers used on PLL8
Indicates the number of High Speed dividers used on PLL7
Indicates the number of High Speed dividers used on PLL6
Indicates the number of High Speed dividers used on PLL5
Indicates the number of High Speed dividers used on PLL4
Indicates the number of High Speed dividers used on PLL3
Indicates the number of High Speed dividers used on PLL2
Indicates the number of High Speed dividers used on PLL1
Indicates the number of High Speed dividers used on PLL0

register.description: Lower 32-bits of PLL0 register write lock key This register must be written with the designated key value followed by a write to with its key value before PLL0 registers can be written.

bitfield.description: Write the kick0 unlock value followed by the kick1 unlock value to unlock the write-protected Partition0 registers

register.description: Upper 32-bits of PLL0 register write lock key This register must be written with the designated key value following a write to with its key value before PLL0 registers can be written.

bitfield.description: Write the kick1 unlock value after the kick0 unlock value to unlock the write-protected Partition0 registers

register.description: PLL frequency programming values.
PLL frequency programming values.
Divider values for the PLL output clocks.
Drives the signals used to load the PLL frequency configuration values.

bitfield.description: PLL programming state 0h - Activation 1h - Programming IDLE state 2h - Load PLL loop values (PLL_FREQ_CTRL0, PLL_FREQ_CTRL1) 3h - Calibrate and lock

register.description: Controls the PLL features and mode of operation.

bitfield.description: Must be set to 1 when CLKOUT &gt; 1.4 GHz is required
Loop bandwidth control 0h - BW = REFCLK/30 to REFCLK/70 1h - BW = REFCLK/60 to REFCLK/10 2h - BW = REFCLK/120 to REFCLK/280 3h - BW = REFCLK/240 to REFCLK/560
Enable recalibration on cycle slip between REFCLK and Feedback clock
Controls the clock ramp sequence 0h - No ramping 1h - Bypass clock to Fout/8 to Fout/4 to Fout/2 to Fout 2h - Bypass clock to Fout/4 to Fout/2 to Fout/1.5 to Fout 3h - Reserved - no ramping

Controls the time spent on each ramp step 0h - 2 REFCLK periods 1h - 4 REFCLK periods 2h - 8 REFCLK periods 3h - 16 REFCLK periods 4h - 32 REFCLK periods 5h - 64 REFCLK periods 6h - 128 REFCLK periods 7h - 256 REFCLK periods

register.description: Indicates the status of PLL operation.
Controls PLL power features.

bitfield.description: LDO domain testmode scan pin control

register.description: Indicates the PLL power state.
Defines the frequency spread when spread spectrum clocking is enabled.

bitfield.description: Spread spectrum spread control integer part
Spread spectrum spread control fractional part

register.description: Defines the modulation frequency when spread spectrum clocking is enabled.

bitfield.description: Spread spectrum modulation frequency REFCLK divider exponent
Spread spectrum modulation frequency REFCLK divider mantissa

register.description: Divider values for the HSDIVIDER output clocks.
Controls the HSDIVIDER features and mode of operation.
Indicates the status of HSDIVIDER operation.

bitfield.description: When set, indicates that all enabled output clocks are out of bypass

register.description: Controls HSDIVIDER power features.

bitfield.description: Set to 1 to switch off VDDA logic to prevent leakage when VDD power is off and VDDA power is active

register.description: Indicates the HSDIVIDER power state.
Lower 32-bits of PLL1 register write lock key This register must be written with the designated key value followed by a write to with its key value before PLL1 registers can be written.

bitfield.description: Write the kick0 unlock value followed by the kick1 unlock value to unlock the write-protected Partition1 registers

register.description: Upper 32-bits of PLL1 register write lock key This register must be written with the designated key value following a write to with its key value before PLL1 registers can be written.

bitfield.description: Write the kick1 unlock value after the kick0 unlock value to unlock the write-protected Partition1 registers

register.description: PLL frequency programming values.
PLL frequency programming values.
Divider values for the PLL output clocks.
Drives the signals used to load the PLL frequency configuration values.

bitfield.description: PLL programming state 0h - Activation 1h - Programming IDLE state 2h - Load PLL loop values (PLL_FREQ_CTRL0, PLL_FREQ_CTRL1) 3h - Calibrate and lock

register.description: Controls the PLL features and mode of operation.

bitfield.description: Must be set to 1 when CLKOUT &gt; 1.4 GHz is required
Loop bandwidth control 0h - BW = REFCLK/30 to REFCLK/70 1h - BW = REFCLK/60 to REFCLK/10 2h - BW = REFCLK/120 to REFCLK/280 3h - BW = REFCLK/240 to REFCLK/560
Enable recalibration on cycle slip between REFCLK and Feedback clock
Controls the clock ramp sequence 0h - No ramping 1h - Bypass clock to Fout/8 to Fout/4 to Fout/2 to Fout 2h - Bypass clock to Fout/4 to Fout/2 to Fout/1.5 to Fout 3h - Reserved - no ramping

Controls the time spent on each ramp step 0h - 2 REFCLK periods 1h - 4 REFCLK periods 2h - 8 REFCLK periods 3h - 16 REFCLK periods 4h - 32 REFCLK periods 5h - 64 REFCLK periods 6h - 128 REFCLK periods 7h - 256 REFCLK periods

register.description: Indicates the status of PLL operation.
Controls PLL power features.

bitfield.description: LDO domain testmode scan pin control

register.description: Indicates the PLL power state.
Defines the frequency spread when spread spectrum clocking is enabled.

bitfield.description: Spread spectrum spread control integer part
Spread spectrum spread control fractional part

register.description: Defines the modulation frequency when spread spectrum clocking is enabled.

bitfield.description: Spread spectrum modulation frequency REFCLK divider exponent
Spread spectrum modulation frequency REFCLK divider mantissa

register.description: Divider values for the HSDIVIDER output clocks.
Controls the HSDIVIDER features and mode of operation.
Indicates the status of HSDIVIDER operation.

bitfield.description: When set, indicates that all enabled output clocks are out of bypass

register.description: Controls HSDIVIDER power features.

bitfield.description: Set to 1 to switch off VDDA logic to prevent leakage when VDD power is off and VDDA power is active

register.description: Indicates the HSDIVIDER power state.
